tweets.text:
In September SERT travelled a bit further afield than usual to achieve #FishPassage at an @EnvAgency gauging station on the River Ock, Abbingdon. 
There were numerous constraints at this site so we are piloting a Bristle Fish Pass. Read all about it here:
https://t.co/vf5Bxb6t5w https://t.co/u119h0xuFz

Never drive through flood water ‚Äì it‚Äôs not worth the risk. 

Not only can flood water damage your car but it can be life threatening.

Artist Clare Ashton of Todmorden says this year there will be a greater impact than ever on anyone whose home is flooded.

Read her story
https://t.co/OqdkZb8nDm

Taking action before a flood could keep the things you care about safe #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/wwueotBnkz https://t.co/bbHBhUd8Gt

In September SERT travelled a bit further afield than usual to achieve #FishPassage at an @EnvAgency gauging station on the River Ock, Abbingdon. 
There were numerous constraints at this site so we are piloting a Bristle Fish Pass. Read all about it here:
https://t.co/vf5Bxb6t5w https://t.co/u119h0xuFz

River users in Northumberland are being asked to ‚Äòcheck, clean, dry‚Äô to help prevent the spread of diseases & safeguard the future of native white-clawed crayfish in the River Wansbeck after increased reports of invasive signal crayfish in the River Coquet https://t.co/cAPO74ouLi https://t.co/ZSoZOnuIpu

tweets.text: Excited to begin work on a nature recovery network for Leicestershire and Rutland with @NatForestCo, @LeicsWildlife, @Leicester_News, @LeicsCountyHall, @EnvAgencyMids and more. @NaturalEngland #TogetherForNature https://t.co/bRXkpV9WBx

We need to demolish Shade Chapel to open up the culvert beneath it to help reduce the flood risk for people in Todmorden. 

Part of Rochdale Road will be closed from 8pm on Fri 27 Nov until 6am Mon 30 Nov so that the work can be carried out safely.

https://t.co/j8x6wTIfoD https://t.co/NsQltBv5y8

Work to improve flood defences in #Fishlake, #Doncaster which was badly hit by the November 2019 floods, started last month. Here's area flood risk manager Helen Batt talking about work which will make #flood defences in the area more resilient. https://t.co/Zqt4pI1Jx1 https://t.co/ciiPakfoEq

Our officers have been on site at the Bradford fire throughout the night & still there supporting @WYFR, @Bradfordmdc & @WestYorksPolice.
 
We're working to make sure fire-fighting water does not present a flood risk to nearby properties & are monitorign the water quality. https://t.co/xf5pgmAApO

We are working with @wiltscouncil on some big plans for #Salisbury. Have your say about #SalisburyRiverPark, a project that aims to reduce flood risk, improve environmental opportunities and create green spaces #LocalGrowthFund @SWLEP @SalisburyCC   https://t.co/hBUHsaNJw4 https://t.co/GxgJAqUapO

Works are ongoing to better protect 220 properties from flooding in #Egremont with some great progress being made on the Skirting Beck and Whangs Beck Flood Risk Management Scheme. 

The latest information is available on the Flood Hub https://t.co/3LgDD6bNSw https://t.co/YcAtOFutc8

We‚Äôre at #Chiswell #Dorset today testing the flood sirens. We do this every year to make sure they are working to warn the local community that #flooding is imminent. Just a test though! They are loud- and they need to be‚Ä¶stay tuned for more! #Floodaware

The end of my last day at @EnvAgency it‚Äôs been an absolute pleasure working with so many great people to make our world a better place. Looking forward to new challenges at @SouthernWater https://t.co/0biuCcEUAY

tweets.text: The @EnvAgency has issued six flood alerts for areas around #Surrey, warning of potential flooding of roads and #Waterways following bouts of heavy rain over the weekend. See https://t.co/Mhxb61C7ev for details. https://t.co/y0Lr24CZTm

Our #EnvironmentOfficers worked closely with @WYFRS, @YorkshireWater & @bradfordmdc to offer specialist advice on fire water run off, pollution and waste.

They were quick to request our #FieldOps team last night to make sure all water made it to the foul sewer. https://t.co/tUXpObW7xP

Our Firefighters are still working hard in response to the large fire on Upper Castle Street, Bradford. 

Crews are now using foam to help tackle the blaze. 

üëâ A reminder for all local residents to please continue to keep your doors & windows closed. üëà
